text:
Users that only have the visit role for the current page can't perform some
operations which would seem logical for them to be able to do so. There are two
things a user with visit role definately should be able to do, and at least two
that probably should be able to do.

The two definate issues are that users should always be able to logout or change
their password. The two possible issues is to view the tab.overview usecase of
any page as this is the default usecase for the "Site" tab. Also, a user with
visit role should be able to view the site tree in this tab. How else are they
to get to their content that is not visible in navigation? I however can't find
what is controlling access to it, as it is requesting sitetree-fragment.xml
without a usecase. Users with the role review should also be able to get to this
content.
creator: rfrovarp@apache.org

text:
Created attachment 19021
For defautl publication

Allows users with visit role to logout, change password, and view the overview
of any page. Allows users with review role to view overview of any page. Does
not fix sitetree-fragment.xml issue.
creator: rfrovarp@apache.org
